content:
RepeaterDesigner Class

In this Article

Extends design-time behavior for the Repeater control.

Syntax

Declaration

public class RepeaterDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner, System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceProvider

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ComponentDesigner
  • HtmlControlDesigner
  • System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner
  • RepeaterDesigner

Constructors summary

RepeaterDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the RepeaterDesigner class.

Properties summary

ActionLists

Gets the action list collection for the control designer.
DataMember

Gets or sets the name of a specific table or view in the data source object to bind the Repeater control to.
DataSource

A data-binding expression that identifies the source of data for the associated Repeater control.
DataSourceDesigner

Provides access to the associated designer component for the data source.
DataSourceID

Gets or sets the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater.DataSourceID* property of the associated control.
DesignerView

Gets the DesignerDataSourceView object associated with the data source of this designer.
TemplatesExist

Gets a value indicating whether the associated control has any templates defined.

Methods summary

Dispose(Boolean)

Releases the unmanaged resources used by the RepeaterDesigner object and optionally releases the managed resources.
ExecuteChooseDataSourcePostSteps()

Called by a design host such as Visual Studio 2005 after a user selects a data source at design time.
GetDesignTimeDataSource(Int32)

Returns design-time sample data based on the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.RepeaterDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource* method and using the specified number of rows.
GetDesignTimeDataSource(IEnumerable,Int32)

Returns design-time sample data based on the provided data and using the specified number of rows.
GetDesignTimeHtml()

Retrieves the HTML markup to be used for the design-time representation of the control.
GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml()

Retrieves the HTML markup to represent a Web server control at design time that will have no visual representation at run time.
GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(Exception)

Retrieves the HTML markup that provides information about the specified exception.
GetResolvedSelectedDataSource()

Gets the selected data member from the selected data source.
GetSelectedDataSource()

Retrieves the selected data source component from the container of the associated Repeater control.
Initialize(IComponent)

Initializes the designer with the provided Repeater control.
OnComponentChanged(Object,ComponentChangedEventArgs)

Called when the associated control changes.
OnDataSourceChanged()

Handles changes made to the data source
PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

Filters the properties to replace the runtime data source property descriptor with the designer's property descriptor.

Constructors

  • RepeaterDesigner()

    Initializes a new instance of the RepeaterDesigner class.

    public RepeaterDesigner ();

Properties

  • ActionLists

    Gets the action list collection for the control designer.

    public override System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection ActionLists { get; }

    Property Value

    • DesignerActionListCollection

      A DesignerActionListCollection object that contains the DesignerActionList items for the control designer.

  • DataMember

    Gets or sets the name of a specific table or view in the data source object to bind the Repeater control to.

    public string DataMember { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of a table or view in the data source.

  • DataSource

    A data-binding expression that identifies the source of data for the associated Repeater control.

    public string DataSource { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A data binding expression.

  • DataSourceDesigner

    Provides access to the associated designer component for the data source.

    public System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceDesigner DataSourceDesigner { get; }

    Property Value

    • IDataSourceDesigner

      An IDataSourceDesigner object.

  • DataSourceID

    Gets or sets the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.Repeater.DataSourceID* property of the associated control.

    public string DataSourceID { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The ID of the associated control's data source control.

  • DesignerView

    Gets the DesignerDataSourceView object associated with the data source of this designer.

    public System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerDataSourceView DesignerView { get; }

    Property Value

    • DesignerDataSourceView

      The DesignerDataSourceView associated with the data source of this designer.

  • TemplatesExist

    Gets a value indicating whether the associated control has any templates defined.

    protected bool TemplatesExist { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      A value that indicates whether any templates are defined for the associated control.

Methods

  • Dispose(Boolean)

    Releases the unmanaged resources used by the RepeaterDesigner object and optionally releases the managed resources.

    protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);

    Parameters

    • disposing
      Boolean

      true to release both the managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only the unmanaged resources.

    Remarks

    When the disposing parameter is true, the Dispose method releases all the resources held by the managed objects that this RepeaterDesigner object references.

  • ExecuteChooseDataSourcePostSteps()

    Called by a design host such as Visual Studio 2005 after a user selects a data source at design time.

    protected virtual void ExecuteChooseDataSourcePostSteps ();

    Remarks

    This method is available for derived classes that require additional processing after a user selects a data source at design time.

  • GetDesignTimeDataSource(Int32)

    Returns design-time sample data based on the stem.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.RepeaterDesigner.GetResolvedSelectedDataSource* method and using the specified number of rows.

    protected System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource (int minimumRows);

    Parameters

    • minimumRows
      Int32

      The minimum number of rows of sample data that the data source should contain.

    Returns

    • IEnumerable

      An IEnumerable object containing sample data for use at design time.

  • GetDesignTimeDataSource(IEnumerable,Int32)

    Returns design-time sample data based on the provided data and using the specified number of rows.

    protected System.Collections.IEnumerable GetDesignTimeDataSource (System.Collections.IEnumerable selectedDataSource, int minimumRows);

    Parameters

    • selectedDataSource
      IEnumerable

      An IEnumerable object containing data to use in creating similar sample data at design time.

    • minimumRows
      Int32

      The minimum number of rows of sample data that the data source should contain.

    Returns

    • IEnumerable

      An IEnumerable object containing sample data for use at design time.

  • GetDesignTimeHtml()

    Retrieves the HTML markup to be used for the design-time representation of the control.

    public override string GetDesignTimeHtml ();

    Returns

    • String

      Design-time HTML markup.

  • GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml()

    Retrieves the HTML markup to represent a Web server control at design time that will have no visual representation at run time.

    protected override string GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml ();

    Returns

    • String

      The HTML markup used to represent a control at design time that would otherwise have no visual representation. The default is a rectangle that contains the type and ID of the component.

  • GetErrorDesignTimeHtml(Exception)

    Retrieves the HTML markup that provides information about the specified exception.

    protected override string GetErrorDesignTimeHtml (Exception e);

    Parameters

    • e
      Exception

      The exception that occurred.

    Returns

    • String

      The design-time HTML markup for the specified exception.

  • GetResolvedSelectedDataSource()

    Gets the selected data member from the selected data source.

    public System.Collections.IEnumerable GetResolvedSelectedDataSource ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerable

      An IEnumerable that contains a collection of values used to supply design-time data. The default value is null.

    Remarks

    The GetResolvedSelectedDataSource method uses the GetSelectedDataSource method to construct a data source from the object that is specified by the DataSource and DataMember properties.

  • GetSelectedDataSource()

    Retrieves the selected data source component from the container of the associated Repeater control.

    public object GetSelectedDataSource ();

    Returns

    • Object

      The selected data source; null if a data source is not found or if a data source with the selected name does not exist.

    Remarks

    The GetSelectedDataSource method uses the GetSelectedDataSource method to construct a data source from the object that is specified by the DataSource property.

  • Initialize(IComponent)

    Initializes the designer with the provided Repeater control.

    public override void Initialize (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component);

    Parameters

    • component
      IComponent

      The associated Repeater control.

  • OnComponentChanged(Object,ComponentChangedEventArgs)

    Called when the associated control changes.

    public override void OnComponentChanged (object source, System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentChangedEventArgs ce);

    Parameters

    • source
      Object

      The source of the event.

    • ce
      ComponentChangedEventArgs

      The event data.

  • OnDataSourceChanged()

    Handles changes made to the data source

    public virtual void OnDataSourceChanged ();
  • PreFilterProperties(IDictionary)

    Filters the properties to replace the runtime data source property descriptor with the designer's property descriptor.

    protected override void PreFilterProperties (System.Collections.IDictionary properties);

    Parameters

    • properties
      IDictionary

      The properties for the class of the component.
